parameters.name: grouped_types
parameters.description: Array of String. Restrict which notification types can be grouped. Use this if there are notification types for which your client does not support grouping. If omitted, the server will group notifications of all types it supports (currently, `favourite`, `follow`, `reblog` and `admin.sign_up`). If you do not want any notification grouping, use  instead. Notifications that would be grouped if not for this parameter will instead be returned as individual single-notification groups with a unique `group_key` that can be assumed to be of the form `ungrouped-{notification_id}`. Please note that neither the streaming API nor the individual notification APIs are aware of this parameter and will always include a proper `group_key` that can be different from what is returned here, meaning that you may have to ignore `group_key` for such notifications that you do not want grouped and use `ungrouped-{notification_id}` instead for consistency.

parameters.description: Boolean. Only relevant if `type` includes `accounts` or if `query` is a HTTPS URL. In the first case, if `true` and (a) the search query is for a remote account (e.g., `someaccount@someother.server`) and (b) the local server does not know about the account,  is used to try and resolve the account at `someother.server`. This provides the best recall at higher latency. If `false`, only accounts the server knows about are returned. In the second case, if `true`, resolving the URL and returning the matching status is attempted. If `false`, this resolving logic is circumvented and a regular search is performed instead.

in_reply_to_id.description: String. ID of the status being replied to, if status is a reply.

sensitive.description: Boolean. Mark status and attached media as sensitive? Defaults to false.

spoiler_text.description: String. Text to be shown as a warning or subject before the actual content. Statuses are generally collapsed behind this field.

visibility.description: String. Sets the visibility of the posted status to `public`, `unlisted`, `private`, `direct`.

language.description: String. ISO 639 language code for this status.

scheduled_at.description: String.  at which to schedule a status. Providing this parameter will cause ScheduledStatus to be returned instead of Status. Must be at least 5 minutes in the future.

options.description: Array of String. Possible answers to the poll. If provided, `media_ids` cannot be used, and `poll[expires_in]` must be provided.

expires_in.description: Integer. Duration that the poll should be open, in seconds. If provided, `media_ids` cannot be used, and `poll[options]` must be provided.

multiple.description: Boolean. Allow multiple choices? Defaults to false.

hide_totals.description: Boolean. Hide vote counts until the poll ends? Defaults to false.

Account.description: Represents a user of Mastodon and their associated profile.

id.description: The account id.

username.description: The username of the account, not including domain.

acct.description: The Webfinger account URI. Equal to `username` for local users, or `username@domain` for remote users.

url.description: The location of the user's profile page.

avatar.description: An image icon that is shown next to statuses and in the profile.

avatar_static.description: A static version of the avatar. Equal to `avatar` if its value is a static image; different if `avatar` is an animated GIF.

header.description: An image banner that is shown above the profile and in profile cards.

header_static.description: A static version of the header. Equal to `header` if its value is a static image; different if `header` is an animated GIF.

locked.description: Whether the account manually approves follow requests.

fields.description: Additional metadata attached to a profile as name-value pairs.

emojis.description: Custom emoji entities to be used when rendering the profile.

bot.description: Indicates that the account may perform automated actions, may not be monitored, or identifies as a robot.

group.description: Indicates that the account represents a Group actor.

discoverable.description: Whether the account has opted into discovery features such as the profile directory.

noindex.description: Whether the local user has opted out of being indexed by search engines.

moved.description: Indicates that the profile is currently inactive and that its user has moved to a new account.

suspended.description: An extra attribute returned only when an account is suspended.

limited.description: An extra attribute returned only when an account is silenced. If true, indicates that the account should be hidden behind a warning screen.

last_status_at.description: When the most recent status was posted.

statuses_count.description: How many statuses are attached to this account.

followers_count.description: The reported followers of this profile.

following_count.description: The reported follows of this profile.

hide_collections.description: Whether the user hides the contents of their follows and followers collections.

source.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

An extra attribute that contains source values to be used with API methods that [verify credentials]({{< relref "methods/accounts#verify_credentials" >}}) and [update credentials]({{< relref "methods/accounts#update_credentials" >}}).

source[attribution_domains].description: Domains of websites allowed to credit the account.

source[note].description: Profile bio, in plain-text instead of in HTML.

source[privacy].description: The default post privacy to be used for new statuses.

source[sensitive].description: Whether new statuses should be marked sensitive by default.

source[language].description: The default posting language for new statuses.

source[follow_requests_count].description: The number of pending follow requests.

role.description: The role assigned to the currently authorized user.

mute_expires_at.description: When a timed mute will expire, if applicable.

name.description: The key of a given field's key-value pair.

value.description: The value associated with the `name` key.

verified_at.description: Timestamp of when the server verified a URL value for a rel="me" link.

AccountWarning.description: Moderation warning against a particular account.

id.description: The ID of the account warning in the database.

text.description: Message from the moderator to the target account.

status_ids.description: List of status IDs that are relevant to the warning. When `action` is `mark_statuses_as_sensitive` or `delete_statuses`, those are the affected statuses.

target_account.description: Account against which a moderation decision has been taken.

appeal.description: Appeal submitted by the target account, if any.

Admin_Account.description: Admin-level information about a given account.

id.description: The ID of the account in the database.

domain.description: The domain of the account, if it is remote.

created_at.description: When the account was first discovered.

email.description: The email address associated with the account.

ip.description: The IP address last used to login to this account.

ips.description: All known IP addresses associated with this account.

invite_request.description: The reason given when requesting an invite (for instances that require manual approval of registrations)

role.description: The current role of the account.

confirmed.description: Whether the account has confirmed their email address.

approved.description: Whether the account is currently approved.

disabled.description: Whether the account is currently disabled.

silenced.description: Whether the account is currently silenced.

suspended.description: Whether the account is currently suspended.

created_by_application_id.description: The ID of the [Application]({{< relref "entities/application" >}}) that created this account, if applicable.

invited_by_account_id.description: The ID of the [Account]({{< relref "entities/account" >}}) that invited this user, if applicable.

id.description: The ID of the email block in the database.

canonical_email_hash.description: The SHA256 hash of the canonical email address.

period.description: The timestamp for the start of the period, at midnight.

frequency.description: The size of the bucket for the returned data.

data.description: Retention data for users who registered during the given period.

date.description: The timestamp for the start of the bucket, at midnight.

rate.description: The percentage rate of users who registered in the specified `period` and were active for the given `date` bucket.

value.description: How many users registered in the specified `period` and were active for the given `date` bucket.

Admin_Dimension.description: Represents qualitative data about the server.

key.description: The unique keystring for the requested dimension.

data.description: The data available for the requested dimension.

Admin_DomainAllow.description: Represents a domain allowed to federate.

id.description: The ID of the DomainAllow in the database.

domain.description: The domain that is allowed to federate.

created_at.description: When the domain was allowed to federate.

Admin_DomainBlock.description: Represents a domain limited from federating.

id.description: The ID of the DomainBlock in the database.

domain.description: The domain that is not allowed to federate.

digest.description: The sha256 hex digest of the domain that is not allowed to federated.

created_at.description: When the domain was blocked from federating.

severity.description: The policy to be applied by this domain block.

reject_media.description: Whether to reject media attachments from this domain

reject_reports.description: Whether to reject reports from this domain

obfuscate.description: Whether to obfuscate public displays of this domain block

Admin_EmailDomainBlock.description: Represents an email domain that cannot be used to sign up.

id.description: The ID of the EmailDomainBlock in the database.

domain.description: The email domain that is not allowed to be used for signups.

created_at.description: When the email domain was disallowed from signups.

history.description: Usage statistics for given days (typically the past week).

history[][day].description: UNIX timestamp on midnight of the given day.

history[][accounts].description: The counted accounts signup attempts using that email domain within that day.

history[][uses].description: The counted IP signup attempts of that email domain within that day.

Admin_Ip.description: Represents an IP address associated with a user.

used_at.description: The timestamp of when the IP address was last used for this account.

Admin_IpBlock.description: Represents an IP address range that cannot be used to sign up.

id.description: The ID of the DomainBlock in the database.

ip.description: The IP address range that is not allowed to federate.

severity.description: The associated policy with this IP block.

comment.description: The recorded reason for this IP block.

created_at.description: When the IP block was created.

expires_at.description: When the IP block will expire.

Admin_Measure.description: Represents quantitative data about the server.

key.description: The unique keystring for the requested measure.

unit.description: The units associated with this data item's value, if applicable.

total.description: The numeric total associated with the requested measure.

human_value.description: A human-readable formatted value for this data item.

previous_total.description: The numeric total associated with the requested measure, in the previous period. Previous period is calculated by subtracting the start_at and end_at dates, then offsetting both start and end dates backwards by the length of the time period.

data.description: The data available for the requested measure, split into daily buckets.

data[][date].description: Midnight on the requested day in the time period.

data[][value].description: The numeric value for the requested measure.

Admin_Report.description: Admin-level information about a filed report.

id.description: The ID of the report in the database.

action_taken.description: Whether an action was taken to resolve this report.

action_taken_at.description: When an action was taken, if this report is currently resolved.

category.description: The category under which the report is classified.

forwarded.description: Whether a report was forwarded to a remote instance.

created_at.description: The time the report was filed.

updated_at.description: The time of last action on this report.

account.description: The account which filed the report.

assigned_account.description: The account of the moderator assigned to this report.

action_taken_by_account.description: The account of the moderator who handled the report.

statuses.description: Statuses attached to the report, for context.

rules.description: Rules attached to the report, for context.

Announcement.description: Represents an announcement set by an administrator.

id.description: The ID of the announcement in the database.

published.description: Whether the announcement is currently active.

all_day.description: Whether the announcement should start and end on dates only instead of datetimes. Will be false if there is no `starts_at` or `ends_at` time.

updated_at.description: When the announcement was last updated.

read.description: Whether the announcement has been read by the current user.

mentions.description: Accounts mentioned in the announcement text.

statuses.description: Statuses linked in the announcement text.

tags.description: Tags linked in the announcement text.

emojis.description: Custom emoji used in the announcement text.

reactions.description: Emoji reactions attached to the announcement.

id.description: The account ID of the mentioned user.

username.description: The username of the mentioned user.

url.description: The location of the mentioned user's profile.

acct.description: The webfinger acct: URI of the mentioned user. Equivalent to `username` for local users, or `username@domain` for remote users.

id.description: The ID of an attached Status in the database.

url.description: The URL of an attached Status.

text.description: Text of the appeal from the moderated account to the moderators.

Application.description: Represents an application that interfaces with the REST API to access accounts or post statuses.

website.description: The website associated with your application.

scopes.description: The scopes for your application. This is the registered `scopes` string split on whitespace.

redirect_uris.description: The registered redirection URI(s) for your application.

redirect_uri.description: The registered redirection URI(s) for your application.

vapid_key.description: Used for Push Streaming API. Returned with [POST /api/v1/apps]({{< relref "methods/apps#create" >}}). Equivalent to [WebPushSubscription#server_key]({{< relref "entities/WebPushSubscription#server_key" >}}) and [Instance#vapid_public_key]({{< relref "entities/Instance#vapid_public_key" >}})

client_id.description: Client ID key, to be used for obtaining OAuth tokens

client_secret.description: Client secret key, to be used for obtaining OAuth tokens

client_secret_expires_at.description: When the client secret key will expire at, presently this always returns `0` indicating that OAuth Clients do not expire

Context.description: Represents the tree around a given status. Used for reconstructing threads of statuses.

Conversation.description: Represents a conversation with "direct message" visibility.

id.description: The ID of the conversation in the database.

unread.description: Is the conversation currently marked as unread?

last_status.description: The last status in the conversation.

shortcode.description: The name of the custom emoji.

url.description: A link to the custom emoji.

static_url.description: A link to a static copy of the custom emoji.

visible_in_picker.description: Whether this Emoji should be visible in the picker or unlisted.

category.description: Used for sorting custom emoji in the picker.

DomainBlock.description: Represents a domain that is blocked by the instance.

domain.description: The domain which is blocked. This may be obfuscated or partially censored.

digest.description: The SHA256 hash digest of the domain string.

severity.description: The level to which the domain is blocked.

comment.description: An optional reason for the domain block.

error_description.description: A longer description of the error, mainly provided with the OAuth API.

ExtendedDescription.description: Represents an extended description for the instance, to be shown on its about page.

updated_at.description: A timestamp of when the extended description was last updated.

content.description: The rendered HTML content of the extended description.

FamiliarFollowers.description: Represents a subset of your follows who also follow some other user.

id.description: The ID of the Account in the database.

accounts.description: Accounts you follow that also follow this account.

FeaturedTag.description: Represents a hashtag that is featured on a profile.

id.description: The internal ID of the featured tag in the database.

name.description: The name of the hashtag being featured.

url.description: A link to all statuses by a user that contain this hashtag.

statuses_count.description: The number of authored statuses containing this hashtag.

last_status_at.description: The date of the last authored status containing this hashtag.

Filter.description: Represents a user-defined filter for determining which statuses should not be shown to the user.

id.description: The ID of the Filter in the database.

title.description: A title given by the user to name the filter.

context.description: The contexts in which the filter should be applied.

expires_at.description: When the filter should no longer be applied.

filter_action.description: The action to be taken when a status matches this filter.

keywords.description: The keywords grouped under this filter. Omitted when part of a [FilterResult]({{< relref "entities/FilterResult" >}}).

statuses.description: The statuses grouped under this filter. Omitted when part of a [FilterResult]({{< relref "entities/FilterResult" >}}).

FilterKeyword.description: Represents a keyword that, if matched, should cause the filter action to be taken.

id.description: The ID of the FilterKeyword in the database.

keyword.description: The phrase to be matched against.

whole_word.description: Should the filter consider word boundaries? See [implementation guidelines for filters]({{< relref "api/guidelines#filters" >}}).

FilterResult.description: Represents a filter whose keywords matched a given status.

keyword_matches.description: The keyword within the filter that was matched.

status_matches.description: The status ID within the filter that was matched.

FilterStatus.description: Represents a status ID that, if matched, should cause the filter action to be taken.

id.description: The ID of the FilterStatus in the database.

status_id.description: The ID of the Status that will be filtered.

IdentityProof.description: Represents a proof from an external identity provider.

provider.description: The name of the identity provider.

provider_username.description: The account owner's username on the identity provider's service.

updated_at.description: When the identity proof was last updated.

proof_url.description: A link to a statement of identity proof, hosted by the identity provider.

profile_url.description: The account owner's profile URL on the identity provider.

Instance.description: Represents the software instance of Mastodon running on this domain.

domain.description: The WebFinger domain name of the instance.

version.description: The version of Mastodon installed on the instance.

source_url.description: The URL for the source code of the software running on this instance, in keeping with AGPL license requirements.

description.description: A short, plain-text description defined by the admin.

usage[users].description: Usage data related to users on this instance.

usage[users][active_month].description: The number of active users in the past 4 weeks. This is set to zero for servers with `configuration[limited_federation]`.

thumbnail.description: An image used to represent this instance.

thumbnail[url].description: The URL for the thumbnail image.

icon.description: The list of available size variants for this instance configured icon.

languages.description: Primary languages of the website and its staff.

configuration.description: Configured values and limits for this website.

configuration[urls].description: URLs of interest for clients apps.

configuration[urls][streaming].description: The Websockets URL for connecting to the streaming API.

configuration[urls][about].description: The URL of the server's about page.

configuration[urls][privacy_policy].description: The URL of the server's privacy policy.

configuration[urls][terms_of_service].description: The URL of the server's current terms of service, if any.

configuration[accounts][max_featured_tag.description: The maximum number of featured tags allowed for each account.

configuration[accounts][max_pinned_statu.description: The maximum number of pinned statuses for each account.

configuration[statuses][max_characters].description: The maximum number of allowed characters per status.

configuration[statuses][max_media_attach.description: The maximum number of media attachments that can be added to a status.

configuration[statuses][characters_reser.description: Each URL in a status will be assumed to be exactly this many characters.

configuration[media_attachments].description: Hints for which attachments will be accepted.

configuration[media_attachments][support.description: Contains MIME types that can be uploaded.

configuration[media_attachments][descrip.description: The maximum size of a description, in characters.

configuration[media_attachments][image_s.description: The maximum size of any uploaded image, in bytes.

configuration[media_attachments][image_m.description: The maximum number of pixels (width times height) for image uploads.

configuration[media_attachments][video_s.description: The maximum size of any uploaded video, in bytes.

configuration[media_attachments][video_f.description: The maximum frame rate for any uploaded video.

configuration[media_attachments][video_m.description: The maximum number of pixels (width times height) for video uploads.

configuration[polls][max_options].description: Each poll is allowed to have up to this many options.

configuration[polls][max_characters_per_.description: Each poll option is allowed to have this many characters.

configuration[polls][min_expiration].description: The shortest allowed poll duration, in seconds.

configuration[polls][max_expiration].description: The longest allowed poll duration, in seconds.

configuration[translation][enabled].description: Whether the Translations API is available on this instance.

configuration[limited_federation].description: Whether federation is limited to explicitly allowed domains.

registrations[message].description: A custom message to be shown when registrations are closed.

registrations[min_age].description: A minimum age required to register, if configured.

registrations[reason_required].description: Whether registrations require the user to provide a reason for joining. Only applicable when `registrations[approval_required]` is true.

api_versions.description: Information about which version of the API is implemented by this server. It contains at least a `mastodon` attribute, and other implementations may have their own additional attributes.

api_versions[mastodon].description: Hints related to contacting a representative of the website.

contact[email].description: An email address that can be messaged regarding inquiries or issues.

contact[account].description: An account that can be contacted natively over the network regarding inquiries or issues.

rules.description: An itemized list of rules for this website.

contact.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

List.description: Represents a list of some users that the authenticated user follows.

id.description: The internal database ID of the list.

title.description: The user-defined title of the list.

replies_policy.description: Which replies should be shown in the list.

exclusive.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

Marker.description: Represents the last read position within a user's timelines.

last_read_id.description: The ID of the most recently viewed entity.

version.description: An incrementing counter, used for locking to prevent write conflicts.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the marker was set.

notifications.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

home.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

MediaAttachment.description: Represents a file or media attachment that can be added to a status.

id.description: The ID of the attachment in the database.

url.description: The location of the original full-size attachment.

preview_url.description: The location of a scaled-down preview of the attachment.

remote_url.description: The location of the full-size original attachment on the remote website.

description.description: Alternate text that describes what is in the media attachment, to be used for the visually impaired or when media attachments do not load.

blurhash.description: A hash computed by [the BlurHash algorithm](https://github.com/woltapp/blurhash), for generating colorful preview thumbnails when media has not been downloaded yet.

text_url.description: A shorter URL for the attachment.

Notification.description: Represents a notification of an event relevant to the user.

id.description: The id of the notification in the database.

type.description: The type of event that resulted in the notification.

group_key.description: Group key shared by similar notifications, to be used in the grouped notifications feature. Should be considered opaque, but ungrouped notifications can be assumed to have a `group_key` of the form `ungrouped-{notification_id}`.

account.description: The account that performed the action that generated the notification.

status.description: Status that was the object of the notification. Attached when `type` of the notification is `favourite`, `reblog`, `status`, `mention`, `poll`, or `update`.

report.description: Report that was the object of the notification. Attached when `type` of the notification is `admin.report`.

event.description: Summary of the event that caused follow relationships to be severed. Attached when `type` of the notification is `severed_relationships`.

moderation_warning.description: Moderation warning that caused the notification. Attached when `type` of the notification is `moderation_warning`.

NotificationPolicy.description: Represents the notification filtering policy of the user.

for_not_following.description: Whether to `accept`, `filter` or `drop` notifications from accounts the user is not following. `drop` will prevent creation of the notification object altogether (without preventing the underlying activity), `filter` will cause it to be marked as filtered, and `accept` will not affect its processing.

for_not_followers.description: Whether to `accept`, `filter` or `drop` notifications from accounts that are not following the user. `drop` will prevent creation of the notification object altogether (without preventing the underlying activity), `filter` will cause it to be marked as filtered, and `accept` will not affect its processing.

for_new_accounts.description: Whether to `accept`, `filter` or `drop` notifications from accounts created in the past 30 days. `drop` will prevent creation of the notification object altogether (without preventing the underlying activity), `filter` will cause it to be marked as filtered, and `accept` will not affect its processing.

for_private_mentions.description: Whether to `accept`, `filter` or `drop` notifications from private mentions. `drop` will prevent creation of the notification object altogether (without preventing the underlying activity), `filter` will cause it to be marked as filtered, and `accept` will not affect its processing. Replies to private mentions initiated by the user, as well as accounts the user follows, are always allowed, regardless of this value.

for_limited_accounts.description: Whether to `accept`, `filter` or `drop` notifications from accounts that were limited by a moderator. `drop` will prevent creation of the notification object altogether (without preventing the underlying activity), `filter` will cause it to be marked as filtered, and `accept` will not affect its processing.

summary[pending_requests_count].description: Number of different accounts from which the user has non-dismissed filtered notifications. Capped at 100.

summary[pending_notifications_count].description: Number of total non-dismissed filtered notifications. May be inaccurate.

filter_not_following.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

filter_not_followers.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

filter_new_accounts.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

filter_private_mentions.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

NotificationRequest.description: Represents a group of filtered notifications from a specific user.

id.description: The id of the notification request in the database.

created_at.description: The timestamp of the notification request, i.e. when the first filtered notification from that user was created.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the notification request was last updated.

account.description: The account that performed the action that generated the filtered notifications.

notifications_count.description: How many of this account's notifications were filtered.

last_status.description: Most recent status associated with a filtered notification from that account.

Poll.description: Represents a poll attached to a status.

id.description: The ID of the poll in the database.

multiple.description: Does the poll allow multiple-choice answers?

votes_count.description: How many votes have been received.

voters_count.description: How many unique accounts have voted on a multiple-choice poll.

emojis.description: Custom emoji to be used for rendering poll options.

voted.description: When called with a user token, has the authorized user voted?

own_votes.description: When called with a user token, which options has the authorized user chosen? Contains an array of index values for `options`.

title.description: The text value of the poll option.

votes_count.description: The total number of received votes for this option.

posting:default:visibility.description: Default visibility for new posts. Equivalent to [CredentialAccount#source\[privacy\]]({{< relref "entities/Account#source-privacy" >}}).

posting:default:sensitive.description: Default sensitivity flag for new posts. Equivalent to [CredentialAccount#source\[sensitive\]]({{< relref "entities/Account#source-sensitive" >}}).

posting:default:language.description: Default language for new posts. Equivalent to [CredentialAccount#source\[language\]]({{< relref "entities/Account#source-language" >}})

reading:expand:media.description: Whether media attachments should be automatically displayed or blurred/hidden.

reading:expand:spoilers.description: Whether CWs should be expanded by default.

PreviewCard.description: Represents a rich preview card that is generated using OpenGraph tags from a URL.

type.description: The type of the preview card.

authors.description: Fediverse account of the authors of the original resource.

author_name.description: The author of the original resource. Deprecated since 4.3.0, clients should use `authors` instead.

author_url.description: A link to the author of the original resource. Deprecated since 4.3.0, clients should use `authors` instead.

provider_name.description: The provider of the original resource.

provider_url.description: A link to the provider of the original resource.

html.description: HTML to be used for generating the preview card.

embed_url.description: Used for photo embeds, instead of custom `html`.

blurhash.description: A hash computed by [the BlurHash algorithm](https://github.com/woltapp/blurhash), for generating colorful preview thumbnails when media has not been downloaded yet.

history.description: Usage statistics for given days (typically the past week).

history[][day].description: UNIX timestamp on midnight of the given day.

history[][accounts].description: The counted accounts using the link within that day.

history[][uses].description: The counted statuses using the link within that day.

PreviewCardAuthor.description: Represents an author in a rich preview card.

name.description: The original resource author's name. Replaces the deprecated `author_name` attribute of the preview card.

url.description: A link to the author of the original resource. Replaces the deprecated `author_url` attribute of the preview card.

account.description: The fediverse account of the author.

PrivacyPolicy.description: Represents the privacy policy of the instance.

updated_at.description: A timestamp of when the privacy policy was last updated.

content.description: The rendered HTML content of the privacy policy.

Quote.description: Represents a quote or a quote placeholder, with the current authorization status.

status.description: The status being quoted, if the quote has been accepted. This will be `null`, unless the `state` attribute is `accepted`.

Reaction.description: Represents an emoji reaction to an Announcement.

name.description: The emoji used for the reaction. Either a unicode emoji, or a custom emoji's shortcode.

count.description: The total number of users who have added this reaction.

me.description: If there is a currently authorized user: Have you added this reaction?

url.description: If the reaction is a custom emoji: A link to the custom emoji.

static_url.description: If the reaction is a custom emoji: A link to a non-animated version of the custom emoji.

Relationship.description: Represents the relationship between accounts, such as following / blocking / muting / etc.

id.description: The account ID.

showing_reblogs.description: Are you receiving this user's boosts in your home timeline?

notifying.description: Have you enabled notifications for this user?

languages.description: Which languages are you following from this user?

followed_by.description: Are you followed by this user?

muting_notifications.description: Are you muting notifications from this user?

requested.description: Do you have a pending follow request for this user?

requested_by.description: Has this user requested to follow you?

domain_blocking.description: Are you blocking this user's domain?

endorsed.description: Are you featuring this user on your profile?

RelationshipSeveranceEvent.description: Summary of a moderation or block event that caused follow relationships to be severed.

id.description: The ID of the relationship severance event in the database.

purged.description: Whether the list of severed relationships is unavailable because the underlying issue has been purged.

target_name.description: Name of the target of the moderation/block event. This is either a domain name or a user handle, depending on the event type.

followers_count.description: Number of followers that were removed as result of the event.

following_count.description: Number of accounts the user stopped following as result of the event.

Report.description: Reports filed against users and/or statuses, to be taken action on by moderators.

id.description: The ID of the report in the database.

action_taken.description: Whether an action was taken yet.

action_taken_at.description: When an action was taken against the report.

category.description: The generic reason for the report.

forwarded.description: Whether the report was forwarded to a remote domain.

status_ids.description: IDs of statuses that have been attached to this report for additional context.

rule_ids.description: IDs of the rules that have been cited as a violation by this report.

Role.description: Represents a custom user role that grants permissions.

id.description: The ID of the Role in the database.

color.description: The hex code assigned to this role. If no hex code is assigned, the string will be empty.

permissions.description: A bitmask that represents the sum of all permissions granted to the role.

highlighted.description: Whether the role is publicly visible as a badge on user profiles.

Rule.description: Represents a rule that server users should follow.

id.description: An identifier for the rule.

translations.description: Available translations for this rule's `text` and `hint`, as a Hash where keys are locale codes and values are hashes with `text` and `hint` keys.

ScheduledStatus.description: Represents a status that will be published at a future scheduled date.

id.description: ID of the scheduled status in the database.

scheduled_at.description: The timestamp for when the status will be posted.

params.description: The parameters that were used when scheduling the status, to be used when the status is posted.

params[text].description: Text to be used as status content.

params[poll].description: Poll to be attached to the status.

params[poll][options[]].description: The poll options to be used.

params[poll][expires_in].description: How many seconds the poll should last before closing.

params[poll][multiple].description: Whether the poll allows multiple choices.

params[poll][hide_totals].description: Whether the poll should hide total votes until after voting has ended.

params[media_ids].description: IDs of the MediaAttachments that will be attached to the status.

params[sensitive].description: Whether the status will be marked as sensitive.

params[spoiler_text].description: The text of the content warning or summary for the status.

params[visibility].description: The visibility that the status will have once it is posted.

params[in_reply_to_id].description: ID of the Status that will be replied to.

params[language].description: The language that will be used for the status.

params[application_id].description: Internal ID of the Application that posted the status. Provided for historical compatibility only and can be ignored.

params[scheduled_at].description: When the status will be scheduled. This will be null because the status is only scheduled once.

params[idempotency].description: Idempotency key to prevent duplicate statuses.

params[with_rate_limit].description: Whether status creation is subject to rate limiting. Provided for historical compatibility only and can be ignored.

media_attachments.description: Media that will be attached when the status is posted.

Search.description: Represents the results of a search.

accounts.description: Accounts which match the given query

statuses.description: Statuses which match the given query

hashtags.description: Hashtags which match the given query

ShallowQuote.description: Represents a quote or a quote placeholder, with the current authorization status.

status_id.description: The identifier of the status being quoted, if the quote has been accepted. This will be `null`, unless the `state` attribute is `accepted`.

Status.description: Represents a status posted by an account.

id.description: ID of the status in the database.

uri.description: URI of the status used for federation.

created_at.description: The date when this status was created.

account.description: The account that authored this status.

sensitive.description: Is this status marked as sensitive content?

spoiler_text.description: Subject or summary line, below which status content is collapsed until expanded.

media_attachments.description: Media that is attached to this status.

application.description: The application used to post this status.

application[name].description: The name of the application that posted this status.

application[website].description: The website associated with the application that posted this status.

mentions.description: Mentions of users within the status content.

tags.description: Hashtags used within the status content.

emojis.description: Custom emoji to be used when rendering status content.

reblogs_count.description: How many boosts this status has received.

favourites_count.description: How many favourites this status has received.

replies_count.description: How many replies this status has received.

url.description: A link to the status's HTML representation.

in_reply_to_id.description: ID of the status being replied to.

in_reply_to_account_id.description: ID of the account that authored the status being replied to.

poll.description: The poll attached to the status.

card.description: Preview card for links included within status content.

text.description: Plain-text source of a status. Returned instead of `content` when status is deleted, so the user may redraft from the source text without the client having to reverse-engineer the original text from the HTML content.

edited_at.description: Timestamp of when the status was last edited.

quote.description: Information about the status being quoted, if any

reblogged.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you boosted this status?

muted.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you muted notifications for this status's conversation?

bookmarked.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you bookmarked this status?

pinned.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you pinned this status? Only appears if the status is pinnable.

filtered.description: If the current token has an authorized user: The filter and keywords that matched this status.

favourited.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

error.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

id.description: The account ID of the mentioned user.

username.description: The username of the mentioned user.

url.description: The location of the mentioned user's profile.

acct.description: The webfinger acct: URI of the mentioned user. Equivalent to `username` for local users, or `username@domain` for remote users.

name.description: The value of the hashtag after the # sign.

url.description: A link to the hashtag on the instance.

StatusEdit.description: Represents a revision of a status that has been edited.

content.description: The content of the status at this revision.

spoiler_text.description: The content of the subject or content warning at this revision.

sensitive.description: Whether the status was marked sensitive at this revision.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the revision was published.

account.description: The account that published this revision.

poll.description: The current state of the poll options at this revision. Note that edits changing the poll options will be collapsed together into one edit, since this action resets the poll.

poll.options[].description: The poll options at this revision.

poll.options[].title.description: The text for a poll option.

media_attachments.description: The current state of the media attachments at this revision.

emojis.description: Any custom emoji that are used in the current revision.

StatusSource.description: Represents a status's source as plain text.

id.description: ID of the status in the database.

text.description: The plain text used to compose the status.

spoiler_text.description: The plain text used to compose the status's subject or content warning.

Suggestion.description: Represents a suggested account to follow and an associated reason for the suggestion.

source.description: The reason this account is being suggested.

sources.description: A list of reasons this account is being suggested. This replaces `source`

account.description: The account being recommended to follow.

Tag.description: Represents a hashtag used within the content of a status.

name.description: The value of the hashtag after the # sign.

url.description: A link to the hashtag on the instance.

history.description: Usage statistics for given days (typically the past week).

history[][day].description: UNIX timestamp on midnight of the given day.

history[][uses].description: The counted usage of the tag within that day.

history[][accounts].description: The total of accounts using the tag within that day.

following.description: Whether the current token's authorized user is following this tag.

featuring.description: Whether the current token's authorized user is featuring this tag on their profile.

featured.description: Attribute discovered from JSON example (missing from entity definition)

id.description: The ID of the Tag in the database.

trendable.description: Whether the hashtag has been approved to trend.

usable.description: Whether the hashtag has not been disabled from auto-linking.

requires_review.description: Whether the hashtag has not been reviewed yet to approve or deny its trending.

TermsOfService.description: Represents the terms of service of the instance.

effective_date.description: The date these terms of service are coming or have come in effect.

effective.description: Whether these terms of service are currently in effect.

content.description: The rendered HTML content of the terms of service.

succeeded_by.description: If there are newer terms of service, their effective date.

Token.description: Represents an OAuth token used for authenticating with the API and performing actions.

access_token.description: An OAuth token to be used for authorization.

token_type.description: The OAuth token type. Mastodon uses `Bearer` tokens.

scope.description: The OAuth scopes granted by this token, space-separated.

Translation.description: Represents the result of machine translating some status content

content.description: HTML-encoded translated content of the status.

spoiler_text.description: The translated spoiler warning of the status.

poll.description: The translated poll of the status.

media_attachments.description: The translated media descriptions of the status.

detected_source_language.description: The language of the source text, as auto-detected by the machine translation provider.

provider.description: The service that provided the machine translation.

id.description: The ID of the poll.

title.description: The translated title of the poll option.

id.description: The id of the attachment.

description.description: The translated description of the attachment.

V1_Filter.description: Represents a user-defined filter for determining which statuses should not be shown to the user. Contains a single keyword or phrase.

id.description: The ID of the filter in the database.

context.description: The contexts in which the filter should be applied.

expires_at.description: When the filter should no longer be applied.

irreversible.description: Should matching entities in home and notifications be dropped by the server? See [implementation guidelines for filters]({{< relref "api/guidelines#filters" >}}).

whole_word.description: Should the filter consider word boundaries? See [implementation guidelines for filters]({{< relref "api/guidelines#filters" >}}).

V1_Instance.description: Represents the software instance of Mastodon running on this domain.

uri.description: The WebFinger domain name of the instance (not a URI/URL).

short_description.description: A short, plain-text description defined by the admin.

description.description: An HTML-permitted description of the Mastodon site.

email.description: An email that may be contacted for any inquiries.

version.description: The version of Mastodon installed on the instance.

urls.description: URLs of interest for clients apps.

urls[streaming_api].description: The Websockets URL for connecting to the streaming API.

stats.description: Statistics about how much information the instance contains.

stats[domain_count].description: Total domains discovered by this instance.

languages.description: Primary languages of the website and its staff.

configuration.description: Configured values and limits for this website.

configuration[accounts][max_featured_tag.description: The maximum number of featured tags allowed for each account.

configuration[statuses][max_characters].description: The maximum number of allowed characters per status.

configuration[statuses][max_media_attach.description: The maximum number of media attachments that can be added to a status.

configuration[statuses][characters_reser.description: Each URL in a status will be assumed to be exactly this many characters.

configuration[media_attachments].description: Hints for which attachments will be accepted.

configuration[media_attachments][support.description: Contains MIME types that can be uploaded.

configuration[media_attachments][image_s.description: The maximum size of any uploaded image, in bytes.

configuration[media_attachments][image_m.description: The maximum number of pixels (width times height) for image uploads.

configuration[media_attachments][video_s.description: The maximum size of any uploaded video, in bytes.

configuration[media_attachments][video_f.description: The maximum frame rate for any uploaded video.

configuration[media_attachments][video_m.description: The maximum number of pixels (width times height) for video uploads.

configuration[polls][max_options].description: Each poll is allowed to have up to this many options.

configuration[polls][max_characters_per_.description: Each poll option is allowed to have this many characters.

configuration[polls][min_expiration].description: The shortest allowed poll duration, in seconds.

configuration[polls][max_expiration].description: The longest allowed poll duration, in seconds.

contact_account.description: A user that can be contacted, as an alternative to `email`.

rules.description: An itemized list of rules for this website.

V1_NotificationPolicy.description: Represents the notification filtering policy of the user.

filter_not_following.description: Whether to filter notifications from accounts the user is not following.

filter_not_followers.description: Whether to filter notifications from accounts that are not following the user.

filter_new_accounts.description: Whether to filter notifications from accounts created in the past 30 days.

filter_private_mentions.description: Whether to filter notifications from private mentions. Replies to private mentions initiated by the user, as well as accounts the user follows, are never filtered.

summary[pending_requests_count].description: Number of different accounts from which the user has non-dismissed filtered notifications. Capped at 100.

summary[pending_notifications_count].description: Number of total non-dismissed filtered notifications. May be inaccurate.

WebPushSubscription.description: Represents a subscription to the push streaming server.

id.description: The ID of the Web Push subscription in the database.

endpoint.description: Where push alerts will be sent to.

standard.description: If the push messages follow the standardized specifications (RFC8030+RFC8291+RFC8292). Else they follow a legacy version of the specifications (4th draft of RFC8291 and 1st draft of RFC8292).

alerts.description: Which alerts should be delivered to the `endpoint`.

alerts[mention].description: Receive a push notification when someone else has mentioned you in a status?

alerts[status].description: Receive a push notification when a subscribed account posts a status?

alerts[reblog].description: Receive a push notification when a status you created has been boosted by someone else?

alerts[follow].description: Receive a push notification when someone has followed you?

alerts[follow_request].description: Receive a push notification when someone has requested to followed you?

alerts[favourite].description: Receive a push notification when a status you created has been favourited by someone else?

alerts[poll].description: Receive a push notification when a poll you voted in or created has ended?

alerts[update].description: Receive a push notification when a status you interacted with has been edited?

alerts[admin.sign_up].description: Receive a push notification when a new user has signed up?

alerts[admin.report].description: Receive a push notification when a new report has been filed?

partial_accounts.description: Partial accounts referenced by grouped notifications. Those are only returned when requesting grouped notifications with `expand_accounts=partial_avatars`.

PartialAccountWithAvatar.description: These are stripped-down versions of [Account]({{< relref "entities/Account" >}}) that only contain what is necessary to display a list of avatars, as well as a few other useful properties. The aim is to cut back on expensive server-side serialization and reduce the network payload size of notification groups.

id.description: The account id.

acct.description: The Webfinger account URI. Equal to `username` for local users, or `username@domain` for remote users.

url.description: The location of the user's profile page.

avatar.description: An image icon that is shown next to statuses and in the profile.

avatar_static.description: A static version of the avatar. Equal to `avatar` if its value is a static image; different if `avatar` is an animated GIF.

locked.description: Whether the account manually approves follow requests.

bot.description: Indicates that the account may perform automated actions, may not be monitored, or identifies as a robot.

group_key.description: Group key identifying the grouped notifications. Should be treated as an opaque value.

notifications_count.description: Total number of individual notifications that are part of this notification group.

type.description: The type of event that resulted in the notifications in this group.

most_recent_notification_id.description: ID of the most recent notification in the group.

page_min_id.description: ID of the oldest notification from this group represented within the current page. This is only returned when paginating through notification groups. Useful when polling new notifications.

page_max_id.description: ID of the newest notification from this group represented within the current page. This is only returned when paginating through notification groups. Useful when polling new notifications.

latest_page_notification_at.description: Date at which the most recent notification from this group within the current page has been created. This is only returned when paginating through notification groups.

sample_account_ids.description: IDs of some of the accounts who most recently triggered notifications in this group.

status_id.description: ID of the [Status]({{< relref "entities/Status" >}}) that was the object of the notification. Attached when `type` of the notification is `favourite`, `reblog`, `status`, `mention`, `poll`, or `update`.

report.description: Report that was the object of the notification. Attached when `type` of the notification is `admin.report`.

event.description: Summary of the event that caused follow relationships to be severed. Attached when `type` of the notification is `severed_relationships`.

moderation_warning.description: Moderation warning that caused the notification. Attached when `type` of the notification is `moderation_warning`.

StatusOrScheduledStatus.description: Object containing one of: status, scheduled_status
